title: Can we nerf this ridiculous champ yet?
body:
{{champion:104}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:104}} 

Ever since the scuttle changes this abomination of a ranged, bruiser, burst adc w/ mobility has been running rampant in the jungle.

In plat + AND diamond+ {{champion:104}}  has a winrate above 51%, along w/ banrates around 30% and pickrates around 20% in both these levels.  

Yes the scuttle changes shifted the meta to favor graves, since he is strong dueling in the river over scuttles, however this champion just has too much, he has burst, sustained damage, mobility with an attached defensive steroid, and AOE utility from his smoke-screen (and I think people underestimate just how strong "nearsight" is in teamfights/skirmishes).

Maybe, just maybe graves should give up some of his burst, or tankyness for all the other benefits he gets from his kit.   

When he's banned 3/10 games in plat+/diamond+, and picked 20% of the time when he's not banned that maybe should tell you that the champion is a bit too strong, just maybe.

How to crush graves jungle without crushing him in lane (where he's pretty weak and played only by those dedicated to it).

Remove. Knockback. Vs monsters.

Graves, is the only ranged champion in the game that gets this special treatment to make him jungle.
Every other champ in the game with bonus' against jungle monsters, have those to prevent their spells from being broken vs champs (as without vs monsters the spells would need buffs).
This stupid passive allows graves to effortlessly, easily and safely clear the jungle fast and healthy.
Meanwhile tank/mage clears suck, and leave them at 50% health most of the time.

I think the knockback is too strong vs large monsters but too weak vs small monsters. I think if they reduced it based on monster size it would be good.

For example, a Red/Blue buff are knocked back a very short distance, barely even enough to reset their auto attack. A Gromp would be knocked back a medium distance, likely about the same, maybe a bit less. A small Raptor, however, would be knocked back a decent distance. I think this would make him better vs the Raptor and Krug camps, while reducing his effectiveness against large camps. He's able to do his first buff without a leash, even if it isn't optimized that's still a massive achievement that very few other champions can reliably do.

But my issue is why? Why have it at all?
Why does Graves need it when in the past, I could jungle with {{champion:119}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:110}}, none of which had monster knock back on every shot, and a passive that grants me a silly amount of armor. 

And then on top of it, he has his smokescreen to help him kite and he gains an obscene amount of armor lvl 2-3 with E so even if he does get hit, it tickles him at best.
He doesn't need this silly safety net that makes him one of the easiest and difficult to punish brat champs in the game

pretty sure they gave him this special treatment because (when he was reworked for adc in mind) they didnt like the idea that his autos could be blocked coupled with his short range hence the knockback

regardless it would be interesting to see how he would fair without it but i dont think just slapping the ol bonus dmg against monster thing is a good way to replace it

Not saying replace it. Was saying remove it without compensation. As he already deals allot of dmg, has CC to help him kite and his pellets synergise extremely well with red buff (further making his clear better than just about everyone else).

Tacking on dmg vs monsters is never a good answer (why I try to appeal for nautilus shield buffs rather than dmg buffs vs monsters)

Potentially just revert because there's little way to make him viable elsewhere with his current design.
Or make his autos like hydra against minions (so it deals reduced damage beyond the target rather than no dmg)

I personally find that his clearing is too strong, him knocking away monsters allows him to clear better than most junglers.

_They need to do one of the following things:_

##Reduce the Knockback Distance against Jungle Monsters

* Which would allow other junglers to keep up in terms of clearing speed and prevent Graves from getting ahead every game, which leads to things such as (getting ahead in levels, snowballing easier, frequent ganks and so on).

##Reduce his Tankiness 

* Riot were playing around with balance around his tankiness in the past which didn't prove to be meaningful, but every champion needs to have a drawback or an obvious weakness.

##Reduce his Passive Damage 

* Reduce the damage from Passive basic attacks and place that damage elsewhere if Riot want to keep Graves in the high damage category.
